title: Reunion At Dawn
opening: In the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus, Imperialist loyalist Cornelia has subdued all regions of the former royal house of Blaiddyd to prevent further revolt. Prince Dimitri has been sentenced. Now, the backbone of the former Kingdom–Houses Gautier and Fraldarius–struggle to continue the resistance. Cornelia–operating out of the royal palace–has accepted the support of the Empire to build an army and plots to wipe out all remaining Kingdom forces.

In the Leicester Alliance, House Riegan leads an anti-Imperial faction, while House Gloucester directs the Empire’s supporters. Despite the undeniable threat of fracture, the Alliance’s adept new leader, Claude, deftly maintains the outward appearance of a unified front.

In Enbarr, the Imperial Capital of the Adrestian Empire, Emperor Edelgard fights to strengthen her regime. She has extended her reach to the Kingdom by inciting a coup and continues to draw its former lords under her influence in pursuit of controlling all of western Fódlan.

In the meantime, the Knights of Seiros have been dispatched to find Archbishop Rhea, who remains missing despite their searching. Left unattended, the monastery at Garreg Mach has fallen to ruin…and become a haven for thieves.

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: You overslept, Teach. Pretty rude to keep a fella waiting like that, wouldn't you say?

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: What's with that surprised look, my friend?

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: You didn't really think I'd given up — on you coming back, did you?

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: Can you feel it? A new dawn is finally here. Not just for us, though. No, for all of Fódlan.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: It's been five long years. Where have you been, Teach? You don't really expect me to believe that you've been napping this whole time, do you?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: That's a good one! Except… That's not your lying face. I guess I've got no choice but to believe you. You're not exactly normal to begin with, so it's not a huge stretch to imagine you sleeping for that long. Aaand this is where you say, just kidding. Right? If this is a rib, now's the time to fess up.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: You must be insane. And yet… Fine. I believe you, OK? But that means you don't know anything that happened after your last battle, right?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I guess it's on me to catch you up. As you can see, Garreg Mach was crushed by the Empire and was never restored. The monastery is in ruins, and the town is in pretty bad shape too. Can you guess why?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Huh. It would seem that's one possible explanation, since you insist that's what you've been up to.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Her body was never found, and the Empire never declared that she had been killed. So… No telling.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: All we know for sure is that Rhea suddenly vanished during that battle five years ago. The Knights of Seiros have apparently been searching all over Fódlan for her… But the fact that this place is still in ruins tells me they still haven't found her.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: True. I've got a mountain of questions I'd like to ask her, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Worried, huh? Well, for better or worse, Rhea was clearly fond of you.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: But I'm not so sure whether it would be good for her to return as the archbishop… Rather, with her gone… Eh, never mind. This could be a dangerous conversation. Before we discuss the state of affairs in each territory… Are you hungry? You must be. It's not much, but I did bring some food with me. Let's eat up and go from there.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Phew! I. Am. Stuffed. Even the most humble of meals tastes great with the right company. By the way, Teach, do you remember the night before the ball? I know it was five years ago… But we promised that the Golden Deer House would reunite during the millennium festival. Today's the day we promised to meet up… but no one's here.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: True… There's still some daylight left.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Heh, you know everyone looked up to you, right? Or is this your way of telling me I was a lousy house leader?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Let's just wait a little longer. You never know… Maybe someone will show up after all. Hey, Teach… Just waiting around sounds boring, so why don't we get in some exercise. You know, help with digestion and stuff. You must be in bad shape if you've been sleeping for five years. It'll do you good to get your body moving again.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: You want to play a game?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Something like that. Look, if you come with me, you'll understand. Oh, and don't forget your weapons, OK? I want to make sure neither your leadership nor your skill with a blade have dulled.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: The thieves are here. Apparently they're trying to run off with treasures from the monastery.

battle.speaker: Pallardó
battle.line: What the… Intruders! Protect the goods!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: This is gonna get expensive. Collect everything the thieves carried out!

battle.speaker: Lorenz
battle.line: The barbarity is even worse than the rumors. On my honor as a noble, I will expel these ruffians!

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Today was supposed to be a happy day, but the monastery is in disrepair...

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Over there… Is that the professor? And the others?!

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Professor! You're alive! Guess we'd better handle this before I celebrate though, huh?

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: You finally made it! I guess virtue still exists in this crazy world after all.

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: Is that the professor and everyone else? If they're fighting, I gotta go help!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: Wow, it's you! Here I thought you were dead all this time.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Hey, you're late! Hurry up and help!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Hm, we could split into two groups. If we hit them from the north and south, we can trap their leader in a pincer attack.

battle-talk.speaker: Hilda
battle-talk.line: Professor! Boy am I glad to see you. How did we end up in this situation?

battle-talk.speaker: Ignatz
battle-talk.line: Professor, it's been too long! I do want to chat, but first let's handle these criminals.

battle-talk.speaker: Leonie
battle-talk.line: You've been alive all this time?! Where have you been hiding?! Never mind - talk later!

battle-talk.speaker: Lorenz
battle-talk.line: We have much to discuss. But first, let us dispense with the riffraff. It is a noble's duty, after all!

battle-talk.speaker: Lysithea
battle-talk.line: Ugh. The instant we arrive, we're neck deep in battle. We should've arrived late.

battle-talk.speaker: Raphael
battle-talk.line: Is that really you, Professor? It's been so long! I thought I'd never see you again!

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Ugh, I'm exhausted! What gives, Professor?

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: I was so excited to see everyone again, and then this happens…

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: I'm still tired from the long journey. How did it come to this?

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: Let's all take a moment to catch our breath…

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: If you've got the time to play with those guys, the least you could do is prepare some tea.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Thanks for your help.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: We were hoping someone would come to back us up when we started routing the bandits.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Blame Claude.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Come on, those guys were thieves! We couldn't just let them get away.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: It seems they've been taking advantage of the church's absence and doing whatever they please here.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: In any case, um… I'm glad that all of you are well.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: That's the spirit, Marianne!

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: That was fun! In fact, I wouldn't mind romping around some more!

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: So, you were alive this whole time, Professor. I am not surprised. In fact, that is why I came here.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: And it doesn't look like time has rusted your skills. That's a relief!

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I'm just glad everyone's alive and well. On that note, let's move this reunion party somewhere else.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Now that we've dealt with those violent bandits, we could potentially use this place as our base of operations again.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: What could you possibly mean by that?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I'm talking about the Leicester Alliance taking over Garreg Mach Monastery. After all, it's right in the middle of Fódlan. It's a critical strategic location.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Are you suggesting that we fight back against the Empire?

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: Aren't you getting a bit ahead of yourself? The Alliance is in complete discord at present.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: And as leader of the Imperial faction of the Alliance, isn't Count Gloucester, your father, the main cause of that discord?

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: I… Yes, that is true. It was inevitable. Our house's territory is close to Imperial land, after all. Had we not consented to vassalage under the Empire, they would have invaded immediately.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Naturally. And to be clear, I have no problem with your house maintaining its Imperial ties until we're sufficiently prepared to revolt. The Empire is the cause of the infighting. If we rid ourselves of them, the situation should resolve itself. That's why I'm thinking we should make this our base, raise up an army, and stir up some trouble for the Empire.

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: Now you're talking! Sounds like fun!

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: So then, Mr. Leader Man. Does this mean you intend to rope us into your little scheme?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Leader Man?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hm? Ah. My grandfather passed away. That means yours truly is officially the leader of the Alliance.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: If we had a more reliable leader, perhaps the Alliance would not have been divided…

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Think what you will. All I need to know is if you're in or you're out.

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: I'm happy to lend a hand. I won't let those Imperial dogs set foot in Alliance territory! I couldn't bear it if my village got caught up in the chaos of war.

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: I'll fight too! I've gotta protect my little sis!

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: I will join as well. After all, House Ordelia was once dragged into an Imperial revolt. It ruined us.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: Ah, of course. I understand your motivation.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: I'll fight too… It's time to take responsibility for my own future!

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: I… I don't want to run anymore. I hope I'll be of use to everyone…

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: We can do anything if we work together, Marianne!

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: What about you, Lorenz? Are you going to go back home to your scary father or what?

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: We cannot rely on Claude's scheming to lead us to victory. Therefore, I will remain. It is my duty to ensure Claude does not worsen the situation in the Alliance.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: All of us are fighting for a different reason, but we share a common enemy. If we don't act, the Empire will crush us eventually. I say we stop them before they have the chance! So, Teach… Will you help as well?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'd rather search for Rhea than fight.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: All the more reason to join us. Admit it. You're not going to be able to do much on your own.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'll give it some thought.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Please do. I'm counting on you. Even if your ultimate goal is to find Rhea, it would be better to stick with us as you search.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: With you on our side, the church will join us as well. That makes fighting the Empire a moral cause, which means it will be easier to rally support. Above all, your knowledge and strength are indispensable if we hope to stand a chance against the Imperial army. Without you, my schemes are nothing. Just words. Please… Take all of that into consideration as you decide.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: You're really laying it all on the table, aren't you, Claude? Well, all that aside, this place is a mess. We can't very well make our base in a ruin! And repairing it sounds like a lot of work… I wonder if anyone would be willing to help us out with that?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Can it be?! You were alive all this time?!

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: Professor! It is so good to see you again. My brother and I were worried about you.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Ah, thank the goddess… I couldn't bear the thought of letting Jeralt down by not finding you.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: Guess you lucked out.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: We've been looking everywhere for you! But…I see Lady Rhea isn't with you. Damn.

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: Everyone was real worried about you, Professor.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Cyril? Is that you? You've grown up, kid. Have you been looking for Rhea with the knights?

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: Of course. Without Lady Rhea, I don't belong anywhere.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Cyril, that's not… Never mind. We'll figure it all out.

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: Oh my, the Golden Deer House is together again at last. And all grown up! Well, for the most part.

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: I do regret that we were never able to hold a proper graduation for all of you students.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why are you here?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: How is the search for Rhea progressing?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: It has been five years since Lady Rhea disappeared. We have devoted all of our energies to finding her. However, without being able to set foot in Empire territory, we are at a standstill. We had hoped that perhaps the archbishop would return here on this day…that of the long-awaited millennium festival.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Unfortunately, that doesn't seem to be the case. Though, I don't suppose you had very high hopes in that regard. Even if she were able to return here, with the monastery in ruins, I don't think she would have felt safe enough to do so. Right, Hilda?

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Yeah. This is an important location for the church. To think you've left it in such a state!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The believers are mourning this destruction.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It's a danger to the locals too.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: That's true… Perhaps we've left it alone for too long. We've got to make things right!

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: I can clean this place up like new! It's not fit for Lady Rhea like this.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: And leaving this place in ruins affects the safety of this area too.

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: Agreed. There is also a great deal of valuable literature here.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: Then let's do it! If we all work together, we can restore the monastery to its original beauty!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: We will require the aid of skilled craftsmen too. I shall seek out any such individuals who are willing to return to Garreg Mach.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Fantastic! I'll figure out how to split up the work and then we can get started!
